description: An intersection of two B\u00e9zier curves.

___curve2_polys.description: The coefficients of the minimal polynomials that determine the values in ``curve2_params``. This can only be provided if both curves are defined by rational (or at least algebraic) control points.

items.description: The coefficients in a given polynomial, in order from lowest to highest exponent. For example, if a parameter is ``cuberoot(1/4)`` (i.e. ``0x1.428a2f98d728bp-1``) then the minimal polynomial is ``4 s^3 - 1 = 0`` which is represented as ``[-1, 0, 0, 4]``.

___curve2.description: ID of the second curve in the intersection.

___intersections.description: A list of x-y coordinates where the curves intersect.

items.description: An x-y coordinate pair for a single intersection point.

$eref.description: A generic numerical value container: can be an integer, stringified fraction or stringified IEEE-754 value.

_88fraction.description: A stringified fraction. For example ``4/7'' or ``-11/3''.

_88ieee754.description: A stringified IEEE-754 value in ``%a'' format. For example, ``sqrt(2)`` is nearest to ``0x1.6a09e667f3bcdp+0''.

items.description: A coordinate as a numerical value.

___curve1_params.description: Parameters in curve 1 of the intersection points (in the same order).

$eref.description: A generic numerical value container: can be an integer, stringified fraction or stringified IEEE-754 value.

_88fraction.description: A stringified fraction. For example ``4/7'' or ``-11/3''.

_88ieee754.description: A stringified IEEE-754 value in ``%a'' format. For example, ``sqrt(2)`` is nearest to ``0x1.6a09e667f3bcdp+0''.

items.description: A curve parameter as a numerical value.

___curve1.description: ID of the first curve in the intersection.

___note.description: Description of the intersection / notes about how it behaves.

___curve2_params.description: Parameters in curve 2 of the intersection points (in the same order).

$eref.description: A generic numerical value container: can be an integer, stringified fraction or stringified IEEE-754 value.

_88fraction.description: A stringified fraction. For example ``4/7'' or ``-11/3''.

_88ieee754.description: A stringified IEEE-754 value in ``%a'' format. For example, ``sqrt(2)`` is nearest to ``0x1.6a09e667f3bcdp+0''.

items.description: A curve parameter as a numerical value.

___curve1_polys.description: The coefficients of the minimal polynomials that determine the values in ``curve1_params``. This can only be provided if both curves are defined by rational (or at least algebraic) control points.

items.description: The coefficients in a given polynomial, in order from lowest to highest exponent. For example, if a parameter is ``(7 - sqrt(7)) / 14`` (i.e. ``0x1.3e7b70cac040dp-2``) then the minimal polynomial is ``14 s^2 - 14 s + 3 = 0`` which is represented as ``[3, -14, 14]``.
